image.altText: Picture of a high-voltage transmission line

props.synopsis: Tasmanian power prices will remain almost unchanged for the next 12 months and, when combined with state and federal government rebates, consumers could see an overall reduction.

title.children: Tasmanian household power price rise of 0.5pc comes in low after years of heavy rises

image.altText: Woman with hair tied back looks directly into the camera, not smiling.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Education Department and one of its former teachers have been ordered to pay victim-survivor of child sexual abuse, Katrina Munting, combined damages of more than $2 million for abuse she suffered in the late 1990s.

title.children: 'Gaining our power back': State and teacher ordered to pay more than $2m to victim-survivor of child sexual abuse

image.altText: A softly lit street light.

props.synopsis: Birmingham was once a powerhouse industrial city but now the UK's second city is a shell of its former self as rubbish lines the streets, the lights stay out and children grow up below the poverty line.

title.children: The UK's second-biggest city is so broke they can no longer keep the lights on

image.altText: An Australian $100  note is seen with Australian flag behind

props.synopsis: More than 100 Australians earned more than $1 million yet paid no tax in 2021–22, while Australia's highest earners live in Double Bay, according to newly released data from the Australian Taxation Office.

title.children: Millionaires who paid no tax and the richest and poorest postcodes and occupations revealed

image.altText: Chinese Premier Li Qiang meets Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Australians are being offered visa-free entry to China for visits lasting up to 15 days, as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese declares relations between both nations have been "renewed and revitalised".

title.children: Beijing offers visa-free entry to Australians with defence talks flagged to avoid military clashes

image.altText: Plane engine on fire in the sky.

props.synopsis: A Virgin Australia plane bound for Melbourne has safely landed in New Zealand after an engine caught fire shortly after take-off.

title.children: Virgin Australia plane makes emergency landing after engine fire

image.altText: A few people walk up and down stairs. The left wall is white paneling bearing the Medibank logo

props.synopsis: The OAIC alleges Medibank failed to act on multiple reports of vulnerabilities in its cyber security framework before a lack of multi factor authentication led to a major data hack of nearly 9.7 million past and current customers.

title.children: The absence of a basic cybersecurity measure led to the Medibank hack, regulator alleges

image.altText: Close-up Bruce Lehrmann in Toowoomba Magistrates Court sketch.

props.synopsis: The complainant testified via video link from a remote location, with the court ordering Mr Lehrmann be obscured from the woman's view during her evidence.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers to make a 'no case to answer' application on rape charges

image.altText: Tasmanian Archbishop Julian Porteous at his installation ceremony in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Julian Porteous, an exorcist, evangelist and outspoken critic of "woke" ideas, has turned 75 and submitted his resignation as Archbishop of Hobart. He leaves behind a controversial legacy.

title.children: Tasmania's anti-'woke', exorcist archbishop is retiring. He leaves behind a controversial legacy

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu

props.synopsis: The war cabinet was dissolved following the departure of Benny Gantz, a longtime political rival of Mr Netanyahu who had joined the coalition in the early days of the war.

title.children: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dissolves cabinet overseeing war in Gaza

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: For months, a community push has been growing for international student Dev Deka to be granted permanent residency after an alleged assault left him as a paraplegic. The federal immigration minister says he's "looking into it".

title.children: Immigration minister 'looking into' residency options for student Devarshi Deka after alleged assault left him paraplegic

image.altText: A man in a light pink shirt speaks into microphones with an Aboriginal flag and crowd of supporters behind him

props.synopsis: The determination marks the first occasion on Australia's east coast where native title has been recognised in a heavily urbanised area.

title.children: Kabi Kabi people awarded native title over 365,345 hectares of land on Sunshine Coast

image.altText: A merino ewe with her six marked lambs

props.synopsis: Ian Rowett's sheep stud at Marrabel is the second farm in South Australia to have recorded a sextuplet lamb birth this year, an event vets say is "incredibly rare".

title.children: Farmer shocked after 'amazing' merino ewe gives birth to six lambs

image.altText: A man with a yellow checkered shirt walks outside of court surrounded by female journalists holding microphones.

props.synopsis: South Australia's notorious "bicycle bandit", accused of carrying out armed hold-ups over a decade, has pleaded guilty to 10 counts of aggravated robbery.

title.children: Terminally ill man admits to being 'bicycle bandit' who terrorised victims at gunpoint

image.altText: A man with a large beard wearing glasses and a turban looks to the side standing outside a Sikh temple.

props.synopsis: The long arm of the Indian state is reaching Australians with threats against members of the Indian diaspora, the amassing of political power, and never-before-reported details of a "nest of spies".

title.children: 'They're already here, they're already interfering': Indian intelligence accused of threatening Australians

image.altText: Two men and an older woman ineract with one another at a warehouse filled with recycled goods

props.synopsis: As the cost-of-living crisis continues to grow, some NSW residents have turned their attention to second-hand shopping. That move has helped divert 49 thousand tonnes of waste from landfill, while allowing residents to pocket millions in savings.

title.children: 'I'm very anti-fast fashion': How a wave of second-hand shopping is cutting NSW's carbon footprint

image.altText: Rohingya refugee women queue for food aid, one woman holds a baby.

props.synopsis: Rohingya activists fear civilians could be targeted and thousands forced to leave their homes after a rebel group announced plans to attack Maungdaw, a town in Myanmar's west populated mostly by the Muslim minority group.

title.children: Rohingya in Myanmar 'have nowhere to flee' as fighting escalates

image.altText: A woman giving evidence at an inquiry.

props.synopsis: An army chaplain, tasked with consoling the families of four airmen who died in the Taipan helicopter crash off Queensland's coast last year, has denied telling a partner she should "find somebody new".

title.children: Army chaplain denies telling partner of dead airman she would 'find somebody new'

image.altText: A woman's hand with jewellery placed on the side of a rock.

props.synopsis: The cave has been used by generations of Awabakal women for sacred women's business but for years they had to seek permission to access it via a proposed housing development.

title.children: 'Wonderful' news for Indigenous women as NSW reclaims sacred Butterfly Cave from developer

image.altText: Man with glasses speakikng in front of protestors

props.synopsis: During a rare visit to Wollongong, National Party leader David Littleproud confirms that, if elected, the opposition will scrap both offshore wind zones in New South Wales.

title.children: Opposition vows to scrap NSW offshore wind farms in Labor heartland

image.altText: A number of tents and camping chairs on the lawn of a large university building.

props.synopsis: The organisers of a Students for Palestine encampment, which lasted almost two months, say they will be back after the University of Sydney issued a move on order ahead of semester two.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian students pack up protest camp after University of Sydney issues order to move on

image.altText: Three images of Albanese, Dutton and Bandt all smiling in the lower house chamber

props.synopsis: The base pay of federal politicians rises to $233,650 from July, with the prime minister's salary cracking $600,000.

title.children: Politicians to receive pay rise of 3.5 per cent next month, with PM Albanese's salary rising to $607,500

image.altText: A shark in the water close to an outboard engine.

props.synopsis: A professional fisherman says he is "racing" sharks almost every time he brings in his catch, and that shark numbers are making it almost impossible to fish in certain areas.

title.children: Sharks caught on camera taking fishers' catch raises concern about increased interaction

image.altText: Tennis player Andy Murray walks off the court at Wimbledon carrying his bags and waving to the crowd.

props.synopsis: After 20 years on tour, Andy Murray's tennis career is coming to an end — and the Scottish veteran says he's most likely to wrap things up after one final Wimbledon or Olympic Games.

title.children: Bowing out at Wimbledon or Olympics would be fitting, says Andy Murray

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The past week has given us a taste of the degustation of political messages we are about to be bombarded with ahead of the next election. And it isn't pretty.

title.children: We've seen it in the US election, and now it's happening here. What is behind the rise of 'double haters'?

image.altText: Train collision kills at least 13 in India's West Bengal

props.synopsis: At least 13 people have died and more than 25 were injured when an express passenger train collided with a goods train in India's West Bengal state, local police officials say, as rescue teams work to extricate others feared trapped.

title.children: At least 13 people dead, several feared trapped in passenger and goods train collision in India

image.altText: A long exposure shows a nuclear plant illuminated at night, with a white cloud of steam emerging from the top of two reactors.

props.synopsis: We asked Australia's largest energy companies, fund managers and a mining billionaire whether they think nuclear is a viable option for meeting our emissions targets — "unicorns" and "impossible without subsidies" were some of the responses we got back.

title.children: The Coalition says nuclear energy is 'commercially viable'. This is what the experts think

image.altText: An older man with grey hair siles at the camera wearing a brown suit and a blue patterened tie. He stands in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: Fry is a long-term campaigner for the sculptures to be returned and supports the British Museum displaying exact replicas made by a team of archaeologists from 3D scans of the marbles.

title.children: 'There is a sacredness about the marbles': Why Stephen Fry thinks his country should return the Parthenon marbles

image.altText: Singer John Farnham standing next to his son Rob at his wedding. John is wearing a black suit while rob is wearing a cream suit

props.synopsis: After an oral cancer diagnosis in August 2022, John Farnham looks to be in good spirits with his family at his son's wedding.

title.children: John Farnham pictured at son's wedding in first images shared since cancer surgery

image.altText: Rows of blue planes with Southwest written on them all grounded.

props.synopsis: The US National Transportation Safety Board is also investigating why another Boeing 737 MAX 8 "rolled" during a flight last month.

title.children: Boeing 737 MAX 8s under investigation following 'Dutch Roll' and near-miss over Pacific

image.altText: Melissa Wu poses with her hands on her hips

props.synopsis: Melissa Wu will become just the ninth diver to compete at five or more Olympic Games after being named in the Australia team for Paris 2024 on Monday.

title.children: Melissa Wu named to record fifth Olympics team

image.altText: A composite image of three woman and one man all smiling.

props.synopsis: The 77th annual Tony Awards have kicked off in New York City.

title.children: All the winners and best looks from the 2024 Tony Awards

image.altText: A man wearing a car backwards stands by a bright green car, with its doors open.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court hears Norlaila Kyrgios remains consumed by "trauma and fear" after a man pointed a gun at her and stole her son's $125,000 Tesla.

title.children: 'Stole my sense of safety': Court hears Nick Kyrgios's mother is consumed by fear after son's Tesla stolen at gunpoint

image.altText: Freshly baked bread cools on a kitchen bench at Salty's cafe and bakery on the Cocos Islands.

props.synopsis: The smell of fresh artisan sourdough greets visitors after they fly in to the Cocos (Keeling) Islands. The bread is the brainchild of Tony Lacy, who is making the most of the remote island's limited produce.

title.children: Turning saltwater into sourdough on a remote tropical island
